Name: ADF LATLONALT
Description: Returns the latitude, longitude and altitude of the station the radio equipment is currently tuned to, or zeros if the radio is not tuned to any ADF station. Index of 1 or 2 for ADF 1 and ADF 2.

Name: ADF SOUND
Description: ADF audio flag. Index of 0 or 1.

Name: ADF STANDBY AVAILABLE
Description: True if ADF Standby is available

Name: AUDIO PANEL AVAILABLE
Description: True if Audio panel is available

Name: AUDIO PANEL VOLUME
Description: The Volume of the Audio Panel.

Name: COM AVAILABLE
Description: True if COM1, COM2 or COM3 is available (depending on the index)

Name: COM RECEIVE ALL
Description: Toggles all COM radios to receive on

Name: COM STANDBY FREQUENCY
Description: Com standby frequency. Index is 1 or 2.

Name: COM STATUS
Type: enum: -1 =Invalid 0 = OK 1 = Does not exist2 = No electricity3 = Failed

Name: COM TEST
Description: Enter an index of 1 or 2. True if the COM system is working.

Name: COM TRANSMIT
Description: Audio panel com transmit state. Index of 1 or 2.

Name: COPILOT TRANSMITTER TYPE
Description: On which channel the copilot is transmitting.
Type: enum: 0 = COM1 1 = COM2 2 = COM3 3 = TEL 4 = NONE

Name: COPILOT TRANSMITTING
Description: Whether or not the copilot is transmitting.

Name: GPS APPROACH APPROACH INDEX
Description: Index of approach for given airport

Name: GPS APPROACH APPROACH TYPE
Type: enum: 0 = None 1 = GPS 2 = VOR 3 = NDB 4 = ILS 5 = Localizer 6 = SDF 7 = LDA 8 = VOR/ DME 9 = NDB/ DME 10 = RNAV 11 = Backcourse

Name: GPS APPROACH IS FINAL
Description: Is approach transition final approach segment

Name: GPS APPROACH IS MISSED
Description: Is approach segment missed approach segment

Name: GPS APPROACH SEGMENT TYPE
Type: enum: 0 = Line 1 = Arc clockwise 2 = Arc counter-clockwise

Name: GPS APPROACH TIMEZONE DEVIATION
Description: Deviation of local time from GMT

Name: GPS APPROACH WP TYPE
Type: enum: 0 = None 1 = Fix 2 = Procedure turn left 3 = Procedure turn right 4 = Dme arc left 5 = Dme arc right 6 = Holding left 7 = Holding right 8 = Distance 9 = Altitude 10 = Manual sequence 11 = Vector to final

Name: GPS ETA
Description: Estimated time of arrival at destination

Name: GPS ETE
Description: Estimated time en route to destination

Name: GPS IS ACTIVE WP LOCKED
Description: Is switching to next waypoint locked

Name: GPS IS DIRECTTO FLIGHTPLAN
Description: Is Direct To Waypoint mode active

Name: GPS VERTICAL ANGLE ERROR
Description: Vertical error in degrees from GlidePath

Name: GPS VERTICAL ERROR
Description: Vertical deviation in meters from GlidePath

Name: GPS WP ETA
Description: Estimated time of arrival at waypoint

Name: GPS WP ETE
Description: Estimated time en route to waypoint

Name: GPS WP PREV VALID
Description: Is previous waypoint valid (i.e. current waypoint is not the first waypoint)

Name: HSI BEARING
Description: If the GPS DRIVES NAV1 variable is true and the HSI BEARING VALID variable is true, this variable contains the HSI needle bearing.If the GPS DRIVES NAV1 variable is false and the HSI BEARING VALID variable is true, this variable contains theADF1 frequency.

Name: HSI BEARING VALID
Description: This will return true if the HSI BEARING variable contains valid data.

Name: INNER MARKER LATLONALT
Description: Returns the latitude, longitude and altitude of the inner marker of an approach to a runway, if the aircraft is within the required proximity, otherwise it will return zeros.

Name: INTERCOM SYSTEM ACTIVE
Description: Whether or not the intercom system is active.

Name: MARKER BEACON SENSITIVITY HIGH
Description: Whether or not the Marker Beacon is in High Sensitivity mode.

Name: MARKER BEACON TEST MUTE
Description: Whether or not the Marker Beacon is in Test/Mute mode.

Name: MIDDLE MARKER LATLONALT
Description: Returns the latitude, longitude and altitude of the middle marker.

Name: NAV ACTIVE FREQUENCY
Description: Nav active frequency. Index is 1 or 2.

Name: NAV AVAILABLE
Description: Flag if Nav equipped on aircraft

Name: NAV BACK COURSE FLAGS
Unit: Flags: BIT0:[index] 1=back course available BIT1:[index] 1=localizer tuned in BIT2:[index] 1=on course BIT7:[index] 1=station active

Name: NAV CODES
Description: Returns bit flags with the following meaning.
Unit: Flags: BIT7:[index] 0= VOR  1= Localizer BIT6:[index] 1= glideslope available BIT5:[index] 1= no localizer backcourse BIT4:[index] 1= DME transmitter at glide slope transmitter BIT3:[index] 1= no nav signal available BIT2:[index] 1= voice available BIT1:[index] 1 = TACAN available BIT0:[index] 1= DME available

Name: NAV GLIDE SLOPE ERROR
Description: Difference between current position and glideslope angle. Note that this provides 32 bit floating point precision, rather than the 8 bit integer precision of NAV GSI.

Name: NAV GSI
Description: Glideslope needle deflection (+/- 119). Note that this provides only 8 bit precision, whereas NAV GLIDE SLOPE ERROR provides 32 bit floating point precision.

Name: NAV HAS CLOSE DME
Description: Flag if found a close station with a DME

Name: NAV HAS CLOSE LOCALIZER
Description: Flag if found a close localizer station

Name: NAV HAS DME
Description: Flag if tuned station has a DME

Name: NAV HAS GLIDE SLOPE
Description: Flag if tuned station has a glideslope

Name: NAV HAS LOCALIZER
Description: Flag if tuned station is a localizer

Name: NAV MAGVAR
Description: Magnetic variation of tuned nav station

Name: NAV RADIAL ERROR
Description: Difference between current radial and OBS tuned radial

Name: NAV SOUND
Description: Nav audio flag. Index of 1 or 2.

Name: NAV STANDBY FREQUENCY
Description: Nav standby frequency. Index is 1 or 2.

Name: NAV VOR LATLONALT
Description: Returns the VOR station latitude, longitude and altitude.

Name: OUTER MARKER LATLONALT
Description: Returns the latitude, longitude and altitude of the outer marker.

Name: PILOT TRANSMITTER TYPE
Description: On which channel the pilot is transmitting.
Type: enum: 0 = COM1 1 = COM2 2 = COM3 3 = TEL 4 = NONE

Name: PILOT TRANSMITTING
Description: Whether or not the pilot is transmitting.

Name: SPEAKER ACTIVE
Description: Whether or not the speaker is active.

Name: TRANSPONDER AVAILABLE
Description: True if a transponder is available

Name: TRANSPONDER STATE
Type: Enum: 0 = Off 1 = Standby 2 = Test 3 = On 4 = Alt 5 = Ground
